title: Ticket #3041: Support any batch system that blahp supports, part 2
description:
In Condor 7.7.6, we added the ability to support any batch system that the blahp supports with changes to Condor. This took the form of the new grid-type 'batch'. For existing blahp-supported types (pbs, lsf, sge, nqs, naregi), the older grid-types can still be used, and 'batch' is never put in the GridJobId.

This causes some confusing GridJobId values. For example, submitting to a Condor pool via the blahp results in a GridJobId starting with 'condor', which can be confused with Condor-C.

All GridJobId values for blahp-based jobs should use the new 'batch' grid-type. We may want to do the same for GridResource, with condor_submit adding the 'batch' when it sees the older grid-types.

2012-Jul-12 10:18   Check-in [32740]: Fix bug in schedd's conversion of GridJobId. #3041 (By Jaime Frey )
2012-Jun-05 14:37   Check-in [32195]: GridJobId always starts with 'batch' for blahp jobs. #3041 This avoids the confusing situation where jobs submitted to a Condor pool via the blahp have a GridJobId starting with 'condor', which makes them look like Condor-C jobs. To ease the transition, the schedd will rewrite GridJobId values for old [...] (By Jaime Frey )
